name: Larry Bucshon, MD
tweet_text:
Think big because if you don’t think big nothing big will ever happen to you.

I offer these imparting words to the 2019 Student Leadership Summit that I tell my four kids. 

#2019SLS

name: Larry Bucshon, MD
tweet_text:
Question to panel: What advice do you have for incoming freshmen on getting involved?

Grace: Join one club first and use that as a stepping stone and it will lead to other opportunities, I guarantee it!

#2019SLS

name: Larry Bucshon, MD
tweet_text:
Question to panel: How did you pick a college?

Megan: Visit campus! Ask about internships or study abroad opportunities and about job placement percentages. Make yourself a pros and cons sheet. You want to make sure to make the right decision for the next four years. 

#2019SLS

name: Larry Bucshon, MD
tweet_text:
Question to panel: What’s your advice on joining clubs/organization or running for an office as a freshman? 

Elizabeth: If you want to run for an office or position do it! Get out there and challenge yourself.

#2019SLS

name: Larry Bucshon, MD
tweet_text:
Question to panel: What’s the biggest difference from high school to college?

Megan: Laundry! 

Bryce: I was expecting high school round two but was met with something incredibly harder so be prepared for how challenging it is at first. 

#2019SLS
